required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on the Tolerability of Duloxetine in Depressed Patients With Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label Pilot Study on the Tolerability of Duloxetine in the Treatment of Depressed Patients With Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the tolerability of duloxetine, 60mg once daily, in open label fashion, in depressed patients with Parkinson's disease during 12 weeks treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Serious Adverse Events or Other Adverse Events Leading Either to Discontinuation or to Death
primary_outcome.description: The results reported are the number of participants who discontinued the study as a result of an adverse event (serious or other) or death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks on the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Rating tool to follow the longitudinal course of Parkinson's Disease. It is composed of Section I: Mentation, Behavior, and Mood; Section II: Activities of Daily Living; Section III: Motor Examination; Section IV: Complications of therapy. These are evaluated by interview. Some sections require that multiple grades be assigned to each extremity. Only Sections II and III were rated in this study. A total of 160 points are possible (52 in Section II and 108 in Section III), where 0 represents no disability and 160 indicates maximal grade of disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks on the UKU (Udvalg for Kliniske Undersogelser: Committee for Clinical Investigations) Side Effect Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician-rated scale, providing side effect ratings of psychopharmacological medications. 48 items, each item is rated on a 4-point scale (0=not present; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe). The test is divided in 6 subscales, total scores for each subscale are calculated based on a weighted secondary scoring system. Subscales: psychic (score range:0-30), neurological (score range:0-24), autonomic (score range:0-33), other (score range:0-75), global assesment by subject (score range:0-3), and global assessment by doctor (score range:0-3). Higher ratings indicate greater impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a 1-month time interval. 19 individual items generate seven "component" scores: subjective sleep quality, sleep latency, sleep duration, habitual sleep efficiency, sleep disturbances, use of sleeping medication, and daytime dysfunction. The subject self-rates each of these seven areas of sleep. Scoring of answers is based on a 0 to 3 scale, whereby 3 reflects the negative extreme on the Likert Scale. The total score is the sum of the 7 component scores (total score range: 0-21).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks on the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD-17) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using either a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe) or a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks on the Clinical Global Impression-Severity Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Measures severity of illness at the time of assessment compared with start of treatment. Scores range from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill patients).

A scale that measures the patient's perception of improvement at the time of assessment compared with the start of treatment. Scoring: 1=very much better; 2=much better; 3=low better; 4=no change; 5=low worse; 6=much worse; 7=very much worse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks in Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: A 21-item, patient-completed questionnaire to assess characteristics of depression. Each of the 21 items corresponding to a symptom of depression is summed to give a single score. There is a four-point scale for each item ranging from 0 to 3. Total score of 0-13 is considered minimal range, 14-19 is mild, 20-28 is moderate, and 29-63 is severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks in Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.description: VAS for pain consists of 6 questions that assess overall pain, headache, back pain, shoulder pain, pain interference with daily activities, and pain while awake. Participant rates pain on a 100 millimeter (mm) line between two anchors (0= no pain and 100=very severe pain). Here, the line was only 93 mm long due to an error on the clinical research form and scores were adjusted to 0 to 93.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks in Parkinson Disease Questionnaire - 39 Item Version (PDQ-39) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: The PDQ-39 has 39 items. Higher scores reflect lower quality of life. The PDQ-39 has eight subscales: mobility (10 items), activities of daily living (six items), emotional wellbeing (six items), stigma (four items), social support (three items), cognition (four items), communication (three items), and bodily discomfort (three items). Items in each subscale, as well in the total scale, can be summarized into an index and transformed linearly to a 0-100 scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks in Blood Pressure
secondary_outcome.description: For each participant, changes across individual visits were averaged to obtain 1 measurement per participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks in Heart Rate
secondary_outcome.description: For each participant, changes across individual visits were averaged to obtain 1 measurement per participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Electrocardiograms (ECG) During the 12 Week Study
secondary_outcome.description: Included were participants with normal ECG at baseline who developed abnormal ECGs during the study.
Laboratory analytes were collected to assess adverse events which are listed in the reported adverse events section.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment by 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Response was defined as a >= 50% reduction in 17-item Hamilton Depression rating scale (HAMD) scores. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using either a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe) or a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reached Remission by 12 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Remission was defined as reaching a 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD) total score <=7. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using either a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe) or a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).

arm_group.description: Participants received duloxetine 30 milligram (mg) orally once daily (QD) for 1 week, followed by duloxetine 60 mg orally QD for 11 weeks

intervention.description: Duloxetine 30 milligram (mg) once daily (QD) orally (PO) for 1 week, then duloxetine 60 mg QD PO for 11 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Are outpatients, male or female, 30 through 75 years of age
- Meet diagnostic criteria for major depression episode and a clinical diagnosis of idiopathic Parkinson's disease
- Have a clinician-rated 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD17) total score greater than or equal to 15, a Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) total score greater than or equal to 13 and a Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S) score greater than or equal to 3 at both Visit 1 and Visit 2
- Have satisfactory cognitive function
- Have been held on stable dosage of antiparkinsonian medications for at least 4 weeks immediately prior to Visit 1
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any current primary psychiatric diagnosis other than Major depressive episode, and any personality disorder that could interfere with the compliance with the study protocol
- Atypical or secondary parkinsonism due to drugs or diseases with features of Parkinson's disease
- Motor conditions for which it is to be expected to change the antiparkinsonian treatment during the course of the study
- Clinically significant laboratory abnormalities or serious, unstable medical illness
- Lack of response of current episode to two or more adequate courses of antidepressant therapy

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 167 participants were screened and 16 participants were screen failures

Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Region of Enrollment
Current alcohol consumption by participants
Current use of tobacco products by participants
Depression in a distant relative of the participant
Depression in a second degree relative of the participant
Depression in mother or father of participant
Depression in sibling or child of participant
Disease stage of the modified Hoen and Yahr staging scale
measure.description: Stage 1: unilateral disease; stage 1.5: unilateral plus axial involvement; Stage 2: bilateral disease, without impairment of balance; Stage 2.5: mild bilateral disease with recovery on pull test; Stage 3: mild to moderate bilateral disease, some postural instability, physically independent; Stage 4: severe disability, still able to walk or stand unassisted; Stage 5: wheelchair or bedridden unless aided.

class.title: bilateral disease, without impairment of balance

measure.title: Other Axis 1 disorder in distant relative of participant
measure.description: Any axis 1 disorder except depressive disorder.

measure.title: Other Axis 1 disorder in parents of participant
measure.description: Any axis 1 disorder except depressive disorder.

measure.title: Other Axis 1 disorder in second degree relative of participant
measure.description: Any axis 1 disorder except depressive disorder.

measure.title: Other Axis 1 disorder in sibling or child of participant
measure.description: Any axis 1 disorder except depressive disorder.

measure.title: Presence of major depressive episode diagnosed with Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview
measure.description: The Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview (MINI) is a standardized diagnostic interview based on Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders version 4 (DSM-IV) criteria. It was developed as a more concise and easily administered alternative to the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Axis I Disorders (SCID).

measure.title: Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE) Total Score
measure.description: The MMSE is used to screen cognitive functioning and provides measures of orientation, registration (immediate memory), memory, and language functioning. The score range is 0-30; normal: 25-30; mild impairment: 21-24; moderate impairment: 10-20; severe impairment: <10.

outcome.description: The results reported are the number of participants who discontinued the study as a result of an adverse event (serious or other) or death.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks on the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Total Score
outcome.description: Rating tool to follow the longitudinal course of Parkinson's Disease. It is composed of Section I: Mentation, Behavior, and Mood; Section II: Activities of Daily Living; Section III: Motor Examination; Section IV: Complications of therapy. These are evaluated by interview. Some sections require that multiple grades be assigned to each extremity. Only Sections II and III were rated in this study. A total of 160 points are possible (52 in Section II and 108 in Section III), where 0 represents no disability and 160 indicates maximal grade of disability.
outcome.population: All treated participants were included in the analysis population. Last observation carried forward analysis. Two participants were excluded from calculation of change as they had no post-baseline measure.

group.title: Duloxetine

measure.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks on the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Total Score
measure.description: Rating tool to follow the longitudinal course of Parkinson's Disease. It is composed of Section I: Mentation, Behavior, and Mood; Section II: Activities of Daily Living; Section III: Motor Examination; Section IV: Complications of therapy. These are evaluated by interview. Some sections require that multiple grades be assigned to each extremity. Only Sections II and III were rated in this study. A total of 160 points are possible (52 in Section II and 108 in Section III), where 0 represents no disability and 160 indicates maximal grade of disability.
measure.population: All treated participants were included in the analysis population. Last observation carried forward analysis. Two participants were excluded from calculation of change as they had no post-baseline measure.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change on the total UDPRS score from baseline to 12-week endpoint.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for total UDPRS score - change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks on the UKU (Udvalg for Kliniske Undersogelser: Committee for Clinical Investigations) Side Effect Rating Scale
outcome.description: Clinician-rated scale, providing side effect ratings of psychopharmacological medications. 48 items, each item is rated on a 4-point scale (0=not present; 1=mild; 2=moderate; 3=severe). The test is divided in 6 subscales, total scores for each subscale are calculated based on a weighted secondary scoring system. Subscales: psychic (score range:0-30), neurological (score range:0-24), autonomic (score range:0-33), other (score range:0-75), global assesment by subject (score range:0-3), and global assessment by doctor (score range:0-3). Higher ratings indicate greater impairment.
outcome.population: All treated participants were included in the analysis population. Last observation carried forward analysis. One participant was excluded as no data for UKU were available and other participants were excluded as relevant due to absence of either baseline or post-baseline measure.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change on the total psychic subscale score from baseline to 12-week endpoint.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for psychic subscale. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change on the total neurological subscale score from baseline to 12-week endpoint.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
outcome.description: Self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a 1-month time interval. 19 individual items generate seven component scores: subjective sleep quality, sleep latency, sleep duration, habitual sleep efficiency, sleep disturbances, use of sleeping medication, and daytime dysfunction. The subject self-rates each of these seven areas of sleep. Scoring of answers is based on a 0 to 3 scale, whereby 3 reflects the negative extreme on the Likert Scale. The total score is the sum of the 7 component scores (total score range: 0-21).
outcome.population: All treated participants with baseline and post-baseline data for >= 1 visit for >= 1 efficacy variable were included in the analyses (Full Analysis Set population). Last observation carried forward analysis. Excluded 2 participants (no baseline measure of PSQI) and 13 participants from calculation of change (absence of any post-baseline measure).

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: Participants received duloxetine 30 milligram (mg) orally once daily (QD) for 1 week, followed by duloxetine 60 mg orally QD for 11 weeks

measure.title: Change From Baseline on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
measure.description: Self-rated questionnaire which assesses sleep quality and disturbances over a 1-month time interval. 19 individual items generate seven component scores: subjective sleep quality, sleep latency, sleep duration, habitual sleep efficiency, sleep disturbances, use of sleeping medication, and daytime dysfunction. The subject self-rates each of these seven areas of sleep. Scoring of answers is based on a 0 to 3 scale, whereby 3 reflects the negative extreme on the Likert Scale. The total score is the sum of the 7 component scores (total score range: 0-21).
measure.population: All treated participants with baseline and post-baseline data for >= 1 visit for >= 1 efficacy variable were included in the analyses (Full Analysis Set population). analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index from baseline to 4-week endpoint.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for 4 weeks change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index from baseline to 8-week endpoint.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for 8 weeks change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index from baseline to 12-week endpoint.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for 12 weeks change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks on the 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD-17) Total Score
outcome.description: The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using either a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe) or a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).
outcome.population: All treated participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least one efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. Last observation carried forward analysis.

measure.population: All treated participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least one efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. Last observation carried forward analysis.

outcome.population: All treated participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least one efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses.

Each of the 21 items corresponding to a symptom of depression is summed to give a single score. There is a four-point scale for each item ranging from 0 to 3. Total score of 0-13 is considered minimal range, 14-19 is mild, 20-28 is moderate, and 29-63 is severe.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no difference between baseline and post-baseline in BDI scores

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks in Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
outcome.description: VAS for pain consists of 6 questions that assess overall pain, headache, back pain, shoulder pain, pain interference with daily activities, and pain while awake. Participant rates pain on a 100 millimeter (mm) line between two anchors (0= no pain and 100=very severe pain). Here, the line was only 93 mm long due to an error on the clinical research form and scores were adjusted to 0 to 93.
outcome.population: All treated participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least 1 efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. Last observation carried forward analysis. Excluded were 2 participants with only post-baseline data and 1 participant with only baseline data.

measure.population: All treated participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least 1 efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. Last observation carried forward analysis. Excluded were 2 participants with only post-baseline data and 1 participant with only baseline data.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change from baseline to 12 weeks in VAS overall pain scores.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for VAS overall pain score - change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change from baseline to 12 weeks in VAS headaches scores.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for VAS Headaches score - change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change from baseline to 12 weeks in VAS back ache scores.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for VAS back ache score - change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change from baseline to 12 weeks in VAS shoulder pain score.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for VAS shoulder pain score - change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change from baseline to 12 weeks in VAS interference score.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for VAS interference score - change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change from baseline to 12 weeks in VAS pain while awake score.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for VAS pain while awake score - change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks in Parkinson Disease Questionnaire - 39 Item Version (PDQ-39) Total Score
outcome.description: The PDQ-39 has 39 items. Higher scores reflect lower quality of life. The PDQ-39 has eight subscales: mobility (10 items), activities of daily living (six items), emotional wellbeing (six items), stigma (four items), social support (three items), cognition (four items), communication (three items), and bodily discomfort (three items). Items in each subscale, as well in the total scale, can be summarized into an index and transformed linearly to a 0-100 scale.
outcome.population: All treated participants with both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least 1 efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. Last observation carried forward analysis. Excluded were 2 participants with no baseline measure and 29 participants with no post baseline measure.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: Participants received duloxetine 30 milligram (mg) orally once daily (QD) for 1 week, followed by duloxetine 60 mg orally QD for 11 weeks

The PDQ-39 has eight subscales: mobility (10 items), activities of daily living (six items), emotional wellbeing (six items), stigma (four items), social support (three items), cognition (four items), communication (three items), and bodily discomfort (three items). Items in each subscale, as well in the total scale, can be summarized into an index and transformed linearly to a 0-100 scale.
measure.population: All treated participants with both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least 1 efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. analysis.groups_desc: Tested was the null hypothesis that there would be no change from baseline to 12 weeks in PDQ-39 total score.
analysis.p_value_desc: p-value is for PDQ-39 total score - change. A priori threshold for p-values was 0.05.

outcome.title: Average Change From Baseline to 12 Weeks in Blood Pressure
outcome.description: For each participant, changes across individual visits were averaged to obtain 1 measurement per participant.
outcome.population: All treated participants were included in the analysis population. 5 participants for standing measurement and 6 participants for supine measurements were excluded from calculation of change as they had either no baseline or no post-baseline measure.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: Participants received duloxetine 30 milligram (mg) orally once daily (QD) for 1 week, followed by duloxetine 60 mg orally QD for 11 weeks

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Electrocardiograms (ECG) During the 12 Week Study
outcome.description: Included were participants with normal ECG at baseline who developed abnormal ECGs during the study.
outcome.population: All treated participants were included in the analysis population. 54 participants were excluded from calculation of change as they had abnormal ECG at baseline, no baseline measure, or no post-baseline measure.

measure.title: Laboratory Analytes
measure.description: Laboratory analytes were collected to assess adverse events which are listed in the reported adverse events section.
measure.population: All enrolled participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data were available were included in the analyses.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment by 12 Weeks
outcome.description: Response was defined as a >= 50% reduction in 17-item Hamilton Depression rating scale (HAMD) scores. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using either a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe) or a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).
outcome.population: All treated participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least one efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. Last observation carried forward analysis.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: Participants received duloxetine 30 milligram (mg) orally once daily (QD) for 1 week, followed by duloxetine 60 mg orally QD for 11 weeks

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Responded to Treatment by 12 Weeks
measure.description: Response was defined as a >= 50% reduction in 17-item Hamilton Depression rating scale (HAMD) scores. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using either a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe) or a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).
measure.population: All treated participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least one efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. Last observation carried forward analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Reached Remission by 12 Weeks
outcome.description: Remission was defined as reaching a 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD) total score <=7. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using either a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe) or a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).
outcome.population: All treated participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least one efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. Last observation carried forward analysis.

group.title: Duloxetine
group.description: Participants received duloxetine 30 milligram (mg) orally once daily (QD) for 1 week, followed by duloxetine 60 mg orally QD for 11 weeks

measure.description: Remission was defined as reaching a 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAMD) total score <=7. The 17-item HAMD measures depression severity. Each item was evaluated and scored using either a 5-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, moderate, severe, very severe) or a 3-point scale (e.g. absent, mild, marked). The total score of HAMD-17 may range from 0 (normal) to 52 (severe).
measure.population: All treated participants for whom both baseline data and post-baseline data for at least 1 visit for at least one efficacy variable were available (Full analysis set population) were included in the analyses. Last observation carried forward analysis.

event.description: This event resulted in death after completing the 12 week study period but within 30 days after completing the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
